title: Quiz 2 - Mixture And Allegation
instruction:
Directions (46-50): Given below are two pie charts. Pie chart I shows the percentage distribution of milk in five vessels out of the total milk in these five vessels. Pie chart II shows the percentage distribution of water in same five vessels out of total quantity of water in these five vessels.

Note: Ratio of total milk to total water in these five containers is 2 : 1.

quiz.text: Chocolates at Rs. 12.00 per dozen is mixed with chocolate at Rs. 10.00 per dozen in the ratio 3 : 5. Find the price per dozen of the mixture?
options: Rs. 11.00
Rs. 9.90
Rs. 11.50
Rs. 10.75
None of these

quiz.text: Pencils at Rs. 4.20 per dozen is mixed with pencils at Rs. 5.40 per dozen in the ratio 3 : 5. Find the price per dozen of the mixture?
options: Rs. 4.95
Rs. 4.50
Rs. 5.00
Rs. 5.05
None of these

quiz.text: A mixture of 48 litre of milk and water contains 10% of water. How much water must be added to make 20% water in the new mixture?
options: 2
6
4
5
None of these

quiz.text: A vessel of 160 litre is filled with Milk and Water. 70% of Milk and 30% of Water is taken out of the vessel. After this task, it is found that vessel is now empty by 55% quantity of Milk and Water. What is the original quantity of milk and water in the vessel respectively?
options: 60, 100
100, 60
70, 90
90, 70
None of these

quiz.text: A mixture of 80 litre of milk and water contains 10% water. How much water must be added to make 20% water in the new mixture?
options: 5 litre
8 litre
10 litre
15 litre
None of these

quiz.text: A tub contains a mixture of two liquids P and Q in the ratio of 4: 1. When 10 Litre of the mixture is taken out and 10 Litre of Liquid Q is poured in the jar, the ratio becomes 2 : 3. How many litres of liquid P was contained in the jar?
options: 10 litre
15 litre
20 litre
16 litre
None of these

quiz.text: A pot contains 81 litres of pure milk. 1/3 of the milk is replaced by the same amount of water. Again 1/3 of the mixture is replaced by that amount of water. The ratio of the milk and water in the new mixture is:
options: 1 : 2
1 : 1
2 : 1
4 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: Aditya and Manish continued in a joint business for 36 months. Aditya contribute Rs. 300 for certain time and Manish invested Rs. 500 for the remaining time. If out of total profit of Rs. 1020, Aditya gets Rs. 495, then for how long has Aditya kept his money?
options: 16 months
14 months
8 months
22 months
None of these

quiz.text: A jar contained a mixture of two liquids A and B in the ratio 4 : 1. When 10 litres of the mixture was taken out and 10 litres of liquid B was poured in the jar, this ratio became 2 : 3. The quantity of liquid A contained in the jar initially was:
options: 4 litres
8 litres
16 litres
32 litres
None of these

quiz.text: A man has 40 kg of tea, a part of which he sells at 5% loss and the rest at the cost price. In this business he incurs a loss 3%. Find the quantity which he sells at the cost price?
options: 12 kg
14 kg
16 kg
18 kg
None of these

quiz.text: In a mixture of 75 litres, the ratio of milk to water is 2:1. The amount of water to be further added to the mixture so as to make the ratio of the milk to water 1 : 2 will be:
options: 45 litres
60 litres
75 litres
80 litres
None of these

quiz.text: How many kg of salt at 42 paisa per kg. must a man mix with 25 kg of salt at 24 paise per kg, so that he may, on selling the mixture at 40 paise per kg, gain 25% on the outlay?
options: 20
30
40
50
None of these

quiz.text: 300 gm of sugar solution has 40% sugar in it. How much. sugar should be added to make it 50% in the solution?
options: 40 gm
50 gm
60 gm
80 gm
None of these

quiz.text: A dishonest milkman professes to sell his milk at cost price but he mixes it with water and thereby gains 25%. The percentage of water in the mixture is:
options: 25%
35%
45%
50%
None of these

quiz.text: 200 litres of mixture contains 15% water and the rest is milk. The amount of milk that must be added so that the resulting mixture contains 87.5% milk is:
options: 30 litre
35 litre
40 litre
45 litre
None of these

quiz.text: In a zoo, there are rabbits and pigeons. If the heads are counted, there are 200 and if the legs are counted, there are 580. How many pigeons are there?
options: 105
110
115
120
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of milk and water in 66 litres of adulterated milk is 5: 1. Water is added to it to make the ratio 5 : 3. The quantity of water added is:
options: 20 litres
22 litres
24 litres
28 litres
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of Rs. 41 was divided among 50 children. Each boy gets 90 paise and each girl 65 paise. The number of boys is?
options: 32
34
36
38
None of these

quiz.text: Milk and water are mixed in vessel A in the ratio of 5:2 and in vessel B in the ratio of 8: 5. In what ratio should quantities be taken from the two vessels so as to form a mixture in which milk and water will be in the ratio of 9: 4?
options: 7 : 2
5 : 2
2 : 7
2 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: In a bag, there are three types of coins 1 rupee, 50-paise and 25-paise in the ratio 3 : 8 : 20. There total value is Rs. 372. The total number of coins is:
options: 1200
961
744
612
None of these

quiz.text: A barrel contains a mixture of wine and water in the ratio 3 : 1. How much fraction of the mixture must be drawn off and substituted by water so that the ratio of wine and water in the resultant mixture in the barrel becomes 1 : 1?
options: 1/4
1/3
3/4
2/3
None of these

quiz.text: A mixture contains spirit and water in the ratio 3 : 2. If it contains 3 L more spirit than water, the quantity of spirit in mixture is:
options: 10L
12 L
8 L
9 L
None of these

quiz.text: Two vessels contain milk and water in the ratios 3: 2 and 7 : 3. Find the ratio in which the contents of the two vessels have to be mixed to get a new mixture in which the ratio of milk and water is 2: 1?
options: 2 : 1
1 : 2
4 : 1
1 : 4
None of these

quiz.text: A can contains a mixture of two liquids A and B in the ratio 7 : 5. When 9 L of mixture is drained off and the can is filled with B, the ratio of A and B becomes 7 : 9. How many litres of liquid A was contained by the can initially?
options: 10
20
21
25
None of these

quiz.text: The vessels A and B contains acid and water in the ratio 4 : 3 and 5 : 3 respectively. Then, the ratio in which these mixtures to be mixed to obtain a new mixture in vessel C containing acid and water in the ratio 3 : 2 is:
options: 5 : 8
7 : 8
7 : 5
4 : 7
None of these

quiz.text: 8 litres are drawn from a cask full of wine and is then filled with water. This operation is performed three more times. The ratio of the quantity of wine now left in cask to that of water is 16 : 65. How much wine did the cask hold originally?
options: 18 litres
24 litres
32 litres
42 litres
None of these

quiz.text: A container contains two liquids A and B in the ratio 7 : 5. When 9 litres of mixture are drawn off and the container is filled with B, the ratio of A and B becomes 1 : 1. How many litres of liquid A was in the container initially?
options: 26
None of these

quiz.text: A container contained 80 litre of milk. From this container, 8 litre of milk was taken out and replaced by water. This process was further repeated three times. How much of milk is now contained by the container?
options: 54.23 litre
54.26 litre
56.26 litre
52.48 litre
None of these

quiz.text: Vessels A and B contain mixtures of milk and water in the ratios 4 : 5 and 5 : 1 respectively. In what ratio should quantities of mixture be taken from A and B to form a mixture in which milk to water is in the ratio 5:4?
options: 2 : 5
4 : 3
5 : 2
2 : 3
None of these

quiz.text: A can contains a mixture of two liquids A and B in proportion 4 : 7. When 6 litres of mixture are drawn off and the can is filled with B, the proportion of A and B becomes 3 : 7. How many litres of liquids A was contained in the can initially?
options: 15.4 litres
12.46 litres
15.7 litres
16.4 litres
None of these

quiz.text: 200 litres of mixture contains 15% water and the rest is milk. The amount of milk that must be added so that the resulting mixture contains 87.5% milk is:
options: 30 litres
35 litres
40 litres
45 litres
None of these

quiz.text: In what ratio must a person mix three kinds of wheat costing him Rs. 1.20, Rs. 1.44 and Rs. 1.74 per kg so that the mixture may be worth Rs. 1.41 per kg?
options: 11 : 77 : 7
25 : 45 : 8
27 : 23 : 6
11 : 45 : 7
None of these

quiz.text: Chiwala mixes three qualities of tea T1, T2 and T3 priced at Rs. 74 per kg, Rs. 68 per kg, and Rs. 63 per kg in the ratio of 1 : 2 : 4. He added some more quantity of T1 to 4 kg of this mixture. He sold this new mixture for Rs. 84 per kg, there by  making a profit of 20%. How much of T1 did he mix with the mixture?
options: 1 kg
0.5 kg
0.35 kg
4 kg
None of these

quiz.text: Nine litres of water are drawn from a container full of water and it is then filled with milk. Nine litres of mixture are drawn and the container is again filled with milk. The quantity of water now left in the container is to that of the milk in it is 16 : 9. How much liquid does the container hold?
options: 34 litres
38 litres
43 litres
45 litres
None of these

quiz.text: A cylinder which has the capacity of eight litres contains a mixture of oxygen and nitrogen. The volume of oxygen in the cylinder is 16% of the total volume. A few litres of the mixture is released and an equal amount of nitrogen is added. Then the same amount of the mixture as before is released and replaced by nitrogen for the second time. As a result, the oxygen content becomes 9% of the total volume. Find the amount of mixture released each time?
options: 2 litres
2.5 litres
1 litres
0.5 litres
None of these

quiz.text: Two liquids are mixed in a ratio of 3 : 2 and the mixture is sold at Rs. 11 per litre at a 10% profit. If the 1st liquid cost Rs. 2 more per litre than the second, what does it cost per litre?
options: Rs. 8.80
Rs. 10.80
Rs. 12.80
Rs. 14.80
None of these

quiz.text: If 5 kg of potato costing Rs. 5 per kg and 3 kg of potato costing Rs. 4 per kg are mixed, find the average cost of the mixture per kg?
options: Rs. 4.40
Rs. 4.45
Rs. 4.63
Rs. 4.95
None of these

quiz.text: A 20-liter mixture of milk and water contains milk and water in the ratio 3: 2. 10 liters of the mixture is removed and replaced with pure milk and the operation is repeated once more. At the end of the two removals and replacements, what is the ratio of milk and water in the resultant mixture?
options: 17 : 3
9 : 1
3 : 17
5 : 3
None of these

quiz.text: A merchant mixes three varieties of rice costing Rs. 20 per kg, Rs. 24 per kg and Rs. 30 per kg and sells the mixture at a profit of 20% at Rs. 30 per kg. How many kgs of the second variety will be in the mixture if 2 kgs of the third variety is there in the mixture?
options: 1 kg
3 kgs
5 kgs
6 kgs
None of these

quiz.text: In what ratio must a person mix three kinds of tea costing Rs. 60 per kg, Rs. 75 per kg and Rs. 100 per kg so that the resultant mixture when sold at Rs. 96 per kg yields a profit of 20%?
options: 1 : 2 : 4
3 : 7 : 6
1 : 4 : 2
1 : 3 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: 4 kg of potato at Rs. 5 per kg is mixed with 8 kg of potato at Rs. 6 per kg. Find the average price of the mixture?
options: Rs. 5.66 per kg
Rs. 6.50 per kg
Rs. 7.25 per kg
Rs. 8.25 per kg
None of these

quiz.text: A shopkeeper bought 20 kg of onion at Rs. 6.50 per kg and 30 kg of onion at Rs. 7 per kg. He sold the mixture at a profit of Rs. 60. At what price did he sell per kg of the mixture of onions?
options: Rs. 12
Rs. 8
Rs. 7.50
Rs. 11
None of these

quiz.text: Two casks of 48 and 42 litres are filled with mixtures of wine and water, the proportions in the two casks being respectively 13 : 7 and 18 : 17. If the contents of the two casks be mixed, and 20 litres of water added to the whole what will be the proportion of wine to water in the result?
options: 13 : 12
12 : 13
21 : 31
31 : 21
None of these

quiz.text: Three glasses of capacity 2 litres, 5 litres and 9 litres contain mixture of milk and water with milk concentrations 90%, 80% and 70% respectively. The contents of three glasses are emptied into a large vessel. Find the ratio of milk to water in the resultant mixture.
options: 121 : 39
131 : 49
39 : 121
49 :131
None of these

quiz.text: A 12-liters cylinder contains a mixture of oxygen and nitrogen, the volume of oxygen being 40% of the total volume. A few liters of the mixture are released and an equal amount of nitrogen is added. Then the same amount of the mixture as before is released and replaced by nitrogen for the second time. As a result, the oxygen content becomes 10% of the total volume. How many liters of mixture is released each time?
options: 3 litres
9 litres
6 litres
4 litres
None of these

quiz.text: A shopkeeper pours the mixture of vessel A and B into another vessel F. Vessel F contains water only which is equal to 25% of water of vessel B. If shopkeeper professes to sell the whole mixture at the cost price of pure milk and cost price for shopkeeper is due to milk only, then find the percentage profit of shopkeeper in selling whole mixture.
options: 58%
3%
54%
53
55%
